alert.note: Alert for Scott; Stoddard; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 12:29PM CDT until August 08 at 1:22PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of western Kentucky and southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in western Kentucky, Carlisle, Fulton and Hickman. In southeast Missouri, Bollinger, Cape Girardeau, Mississippi, New Madrid, Scott, Stoddard and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1228 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations include... Sikeston, Dexter, Charleston, Portageville, East Prairie, New Madrid, Chaffee, Fulton, Hickman, Bernie, Bloomfield, Marble Hill, Clinton, Advance, Oran, Lilbourn, Miner, Benton, Hunter-Dawson State Historic Site and Big Oak Tree State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
